<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
    private static TextView test;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_gameplay);
        test = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.textViewTest);
        MyClass myClass = new MyClass();
        myClass.myFunction();
    }

    public static void changeTest() {
        if (test != null) {
            test.setText("test");
        }
    }
}

public class MyClass {
    public void myFunction() {
        MainActivity.changeTest();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are creating a new instance of MainActivity in MyClass, which is not the same instance as the one that is currently running. To fix this, you can make the changeTest() method static and access it directly from the MainActivity class. Additionally, you should store a static reference to the TextView in MainActivity so that it can be accessed from the static method.
